item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Saturday, February 8, 2025 at 7:15 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Hotline for modern Apple systems (125 points | 41 comments)
2. Turner, Bird, Eratosthenes: An eternal burning thread (8 points | 2 comments)
3. The PS2's backwards compatibility from the engineer who built it (2020) (99 points | 25 comments)
4. VSCode's SSH agent is bananas (285 points | 167 comments)
5. Value-Based Deep RL Scales Predictably (24 points | discuss)
6. Why gold loves arsenic (2021) (22 points | 5 comments)
7. 25 Years Ago, Joan Didion Kept a Diary. It's About to Become Public (7 points | 1 comment)
8. Asahi Linux lead developer Hector Martin resigns from Linux kernel (621 points | 562 comments)
9. A brief history of code signing at Mozilla (198 points | 68 comments)
10. Implementing a Game Boy emulator in Ruby (59 points | 6 comments)
11. A better (than Optional) maybe for Java (18 points | 17 comments)
12. A colorful Game of Life (53 points | 10 comments)
13. U.K. orders Apple to let it spy on users' encrypted accounts (219 points | 712 comments)
14. Visual explanations of mathematics (2020) (102 points | 17 comments)
15. Station of despair: What to do if you get stuck at end of Tokyo Chuo Rapid Line (359 points | 208 comments)
16. Show HN: A website that heatmaps your city based on your housing preferences (233 points | 82 comments)
17. Show HN: ExpenseOwl – Simple, self-hosted expense tracker (115 points | 40 comments)
18. Starlink in the Falkland Islands – A national emergency situation? (65 points | 41 comments)
19. Five coding hats (12 points | 24 comments)
20. Stop using zip codes for geospatial analysis (2019) (158 points | 118 comments)
21. Ghostwriter – use the reMarkable2 as an interface to vision-LLMs (23 points | 5 comments)
22. Show HN: Mandarin Word Segmenter with Translation (32 points | 11 comments)
23. Three-nanite: Unreal Nanite in Three.js (192 points | 31 comments)
24. Why LLMs still have problems with OCR (94 points | 72 comments)
25. Radiation belts detected around Earth after solar storm (124 points | 50 comments)
26. Zep AI (YC W24) is hiring engineers to build SOTA agent memory ( | hide)
27. The evolution of annunciator signaling for telephones (75 points | 13 comments)
28. Oral History of Andy Bechtolsheim (2015) [pdf] (10 points | 4 comments)
29. Unobtanium 6502 based KIM-1 part now obtanium with FPGA (17 points | 4 comments)
30. The origins of 60-Hz as a power frequency (139 points | 183 comments)
